item.description:
Ok this is the second and third segment of the FARMINGTON RIVER planned to be explored by just a few individuals, PRIOR to the FALL FOLIAGE PADDLE listing....we did the first part last week and have identified the best section and put in for the group. Now we are looking for the best combination and take out area to make the trip a good one for all..

Time, distance, depth are to be observed on this trip so i dont want any winers..(that dosnt mean wine drinkers)..ok no wimps or complainers...because i am not familliar with the next section and its suitability for the recreational kayakers in general.. thats the purpose of the trip..

We are stopping at that big SickoMoore tree for a pee break..

After the paddle, as always there is a food part to the trip..it might be a barbie _q ed rat we caught or just normal food.. I want to make like the trip was from that guy on TV that survives eating buggs etc..but seriously its like a pot luck of lots of good stuff..i have the stoves..etc..even the pot for spagetty loaded..

NO ECOLI BREGERS

Put in: The general description is at the intersection of rte 44 and rte 10 near Nassua's Furniture store in Avon at the bottom of the mountain...#15 Waterville road, avon , CT...
The specific put in is located as you pass the FRONT entrance to Nassua's furniture store off of rte 10, their parking lot is off the the right..YOU TAKE THE DIRT ROAD THAT GOES STRAIT till you see the turnaround and the pee houses..meet there..

To get to the final destination at CURTIS PARK..(in Tarriffville close to the Terriffville Jorge)
head back to rte 10=watervill rd, take a left on terriffville rd, north, and go strait on NOD road to rte 185..take a right, east, then first left onto Weatgoue st, north, this road turns into Terrys Plain rd a ways down..follow to end, bear left = wintonbury/Terrys Plains rd..the raod splits on the right is quarry rd,
just thake the left forke and stay on the plains rd till you hit rte 315 at the bridge.
take a right onto rte 315 go to Curtis Park..(there is no number here and 2 roads with the same name..sort of like Terry Plain(s) road..screwed up town but nice..)the big park part is on the right..the little practice sucker field is on the left, take the dirt road into the field and go to the end dont drive into the river... if you do, take out the food fast..

this is a car switching thing..so no complaining, you will go home if you do.....drop off yaks, someone guards..or chains em up..all drive to end..then enough non kayak carrieing cars, take us back to nassaues..at the end of the day give the people that gave you a rid back to their cars..simple enough..good..i knew i had an intelligent bunch that wouldnt have any problems..

OPS I GOT TO GO DO SOME WORK>>I UPDATE THIS LATER>>

oh, "no maybees , cant trust them and they hold up the trip"...either you go or not..


AL-r=Tourlite 15
Janice=eddyliner 18
?=Greenlander Pro 18
Lisa J=Cobraw 18
Martha K= pungo 12

statistics: 3.5 185 @1.166h, 8.5t cp seg3=5@1.66h 2.8=3+0.5/-0.25

OPS I GOT TO GO DO SOME WORK>>I UPDATE THIS LATER>>
